entry.title: definition example
entry.definition: An enzyme that contains a region to which small, regulatory molecules ('effectors') may bind in addition to and separate from the substrate binding site and thereby affect the catalytic activity.
entry.description: On binding the effector, the catalytic activity of the enzyme towards the substrate may be enhanced, in which case the effector is an activator, or reduced, in which case it is a de-activator or inhibitor.
